verbose_text: Inhibiting dynamin 1 also increased the latency time of the first seizure and decreased the frequency and severity of the seizures, suggesting that altering levels of dynamin 1 may contribute to the development of epileptic seizures.3 Zhang et al found that phosphor-dynamin-1 is downregulated in the hippocampus of children and rats with mesial temporal lobe epilepsy during seizures suggesting involvement of phosphorylation or dephosphorylation of dynamin-1 in the development of mesial temporal lobe epilepsy.4 2 CASE HISTORY.
evidence:
Inhibiting dynamin 1 also increased the latency time of the first seizure and decreased the frequency and severity of the seizures, suggesting that altering levels of dynamin 1 may contribute to the development of epileptic seizures.3 Zhang et al found that phosphor-dynamin-1 is downregulated in the hippocampus of children and rats with mesial temporal lobe epilepsy during seizures suggesting involvement of phosphorylation or dephosphorylation of dynamin-1 in the development of mesial temporal lobe epilepsy.4
